thread.title: Washington and Gonzaga face off in Paradise
thread.title_full: Washington and Gonzaga face off in Paradise | The Seattle Times

author: Percy Allen
title: Washington and Gonzaga face off in Paradise
text:
The dormant cross-state basketball rivalry between Washington and Gonzaga will renew sooner than expected in a place called Paradise.
The teams, which hadn’t played since 2006, are scheduled to restart a four-year series of nonconference games in 2016.
However, both teams are scheduled to play in this year’s Battle 4 Atlantis at Paradise Island, Bahamas over the Thanksgiving holiday break and tournament organizers pitted them against each other in a much-anticipated Nov. 25 matchup. The three-game tourney concludes Nov. 27.
Other first-round matchups include: Texas A&M against Texas, Michigan against Connecticut and Syracuse against Charlotte.
Most Read Stories ESPN video: Percy Harvin opens up about what went wrong in Seattle Amazon angst: from traffic to housing, we’re all worked up It’s election time. Will Howard Schultz run for president? Godden trailing; 5 incumbents move on for City Council Seahawks safety Kam Chancellor still holding out with no end in sight Washington and Gonzaga first met in 1910 and have played 43 times, with Washington holding a 29-14 lead. Between 1997 and 2006, they met each year, alternating between their campus arenas. The Zags won eight of the 10 games.
Washington discontinued the series following a 97-77 defeat in December 2006 with Gonzaga winning eight of the past nine meetings.
Since their last game, Gonzaga has continued its West Coast Conference dominance while ascending to a national championship contender. The Zags finished 35-3 last season, losing 66-52 in the Elite Eight to eventual champion Duke.
Meanwhile, the Huskies have fallen on hard times. They’ve missed the NCAA tournament the past four seasons and bottomed out to a 16-15 finish last season.
Percy Allen : 206-464-2278 or pallen@seattletimes.com ; on Twitter: @percyallen . Seattle Times staff reporter Percy Allen provides a running commentary on the Huskies.
